page.title: 01NORTH OF BRADFORD-ON-AVON
page.content: Mature hedgerow and drystone walling divide the smaller pastures from the much larger arable fields. Deciduous trees flourish as part of a plantation on the south western side and also there are small copses and single but well grown trees standing alone in the midst of the pastures. These add to the beauty of this gently undulating landscape. The soil being heavy clay, it is not uncommon to see flooding on fields and in the narrow winding lanes after heavy rain. Apart from the family farms, most of the occupants of the main residential areas are either unemployed, or commute to the surrounding towns.
